August 27, 2023 ‚Äî 12:43

I‚Äôve updated some things around here over the weekend that I think are worth documenting. There are three major changes:

  • Status update at the top of the page
  • Content is now served through a submodule
  • Blogroll

I love Mu-An‚Äôs status update so much I had to have it for myself. I like the idea of fleeting messages, blurbs shouted into space, with no proper archive. I almost fool myself into thinking nobody will be able to hold me accountable for what I publish there, but we all know that‚Äôs not true.

I enjoy writing [[Densely-linked content]], and for this reason it‚Äôs better for me to have all of my writing in a single space. My space of choice at the moment is [[Obsidian]], and thanks to Github Publisher, an Obsidian plugin, and Tania Rascia‚Äôs sweet writeup on submodules, I now technically don‚Äôt have to be in my code base to publish content anymore.

I‚Äôve taking the liberty of hacking together the most obscene of deployment strategies: every time I update my status, Netlify builds my site and checks the latest updates of the submodule, publishing any new notes, posts, or pages in the process. I am not ashamed.

I won't know you've been here unless you tell me. Let me know what you think about this either via email, Mastodon or webmention. I would love to read about your perspective.
